body: Looks good to me.  I believe similar issue is with Type 2 JDBC driver too. Please consider taking care of this issue in type 2 JDBC driver also
@selvaganesang Yes, JDBC type2 has. I prepared to create a new JIRA and a new pull request to track it after this one is merged.
Is this for extracting the column data from array of bytes sent from mxosrvr.
Yes, you can see the Bytes.extractLong() is most used in all getXXXFetchXXX methods in InterfaceResultSet.java, which extract data from the protocol bytes array from mxosrvr.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/726/

I wonder if we can optimize this implementation as follows:
1) Construct a ByteBuffer for the whole array using array of bytes
2) Use get methods of ByteBuffer to extract the data from byte array to get various columns and other info

I would think this should reduce the pathlength on the driver side and possibly improve the response time for fetching each row.
Are we ready to merge this PR to master? If you have any other comments please feel free to add it here

This is actually a good idea, but to do this, we need to change the entire protocol parsing code in driver, and some other related methods, and requires lots of test work. I rather to file another new JIRA to track this enhancement work, and just keep this one a bug fix check-in.
Good change. A couple of minor comments, but OK to merge as-is from my point of view.
This is just the T2 analogy of https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/487, right? @selvaganesang, if you like this change I think it can be merged immediately.

Thanks for the change Kevin. I looked at the build failures. Some hints/steps for the same:

Following link shows the places where HPT4DataSource is being used. 
https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=HPT4DataSource

As you notice dcs/util /JdbcT4Util.java  needs to be touched, along with the documentation in accessing.doc – You did touch the same file in rest/util. Maybe these files didn't get added in the commit ?

Also it would be a good idea to inform users on dev/user list of this change since applications using the datasource concept need to be modified.

If you need to look at the build failures - follow the links  from the test failure:
https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/732/

Let’s say we need to check on the debug failure - click on the same:
https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/build-master-release/859/

Click on Console Output :
https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/build-master-release/859/console

Click on Detailed logs :
http://traf-testlogs.esgyn.com/PullReq/491/732/build-master-release/

Click on Make.log
http://traf-testlogs.esgyn.com/PullReq/491/732/build-master-release/Make.log

Search for “***” and look for errors before this page.

[ERROR] /home/jenkins/workspace/build-master-release/trafodion/dcs/src/main/java/org/trafodion/dcs/util/JdbcT4Util.java:[53,28] error: cannot find symbol  ##(DCS)
[ERROR] package org.trafodion.jdbc.t4  ##(DCS)

From my perspective, I think we have nothing else to do for this bug fix PR.
Hi @selvaganesang,
Any other comment?
sorry, check in wrong version, need to resubmit later.
So, we are just waiting for a thumbs-up from @amandamoran before committing this?
Really good to have support for these additional data types. Unfortunately, I just found a problem we need to solve, see comment.
Currently, I believe target data type conversion is missing in Hdfs scan operator. @anoopsharma00 is planning to add the target data type conversion. Can we hold this PR till it is done.
@kevinxu021 and @arvind-narain Is this PR good to go?

It might be good to change the URL too. jdbc:t4jdbc: URL is quit generic.
We might need to have trafodion in the URL.

Selva

Hi, Selva, 
I don't know the impact of 'data type conversion in scan' with this change. I totally agree to hold this PR till that job is done. I am not fully understand the whole picture here, so if this change has some dependencies, we need to hold this PR.
But I just don't understand why it is dependent on Anoop's change, is there a JIRA to describe it?
thanks,
Ming

@ming The JIRAs are TRAFODION-1961 and TRAFODION-1164. At the time of scanning the hive data is treated like VARCHAR instead of the actual data type and this was causing the empty string not to be treated as NULL when there are numeric columns. So, target data type concept is being introduced.
@selvaganesang thanks, I see, so I will wait and rework after that change. Logic maybe different.

In other cases, we support multiple versions simultaneously by generating multiple TRX files.  I'm not sure we want to add more TRX files, but I'm also not sure we want to switch how the build works based on content of install_features file.

Previously it works the other way round -- the install_features file indicates what TRX files are available, hence which distros are supported.
Looks good to me. Nice find.
Looks good to me, but this is outside my area of expertise. Will commit tomorrow if there are no dissenting comments.
Can we merge this ? I would like to check if hive/TEST018 succeeds with this change in master branch
Yes, feel free to merge. I was going to do it tomorrow morning if there were no negative comments. But I think it is OK to merge now.
Looks good, one lower priority question.
jenkins, retest -- change build scripts to not build installer second time if already included in main build
